xrn:ReleaseNotes.Summary: Freecast is a Java application which allows peer-to-peer stream broadcast. It make possible a stream broadcast to a large number of listeners from a simple DSL connection.

Release.Summary: NAT support and embedded Ogg encoder

Feature.Title: UDP transport layer
Feature.Item: Connections between nodes are now performed via UDP connections. Network problems are overcomed more easily. Note that socket receivers are replaced by udp receivers. The new transport layer uses the Apache Mina API (http://directory.apache.org/subprojects/mina/).

Feature.Title: NAT traversal
Feature.Item: Two nodes can open a connection even if they are both behind a NAT (routeur or equivalent equipment). This new feature allows larger FreeCast networks and removes the manual forward configuration requirement.

Feature.Title: STUN reference
Feature.Item: Node can perform STUN requests to determinate its public address. Required for NAT traversal. Use Jstun API (http://jstun.javawi.de/).

Feature.Title: Latency analysis
Feature.Item: The FreeCast protocol includes messages used to estimate the network latency between nodes. A node opens connections to several other nodes and uses the connection with the lower latency.

Feature.Title: Embedded Ogg encoder
Feature.Item: To make simplier FreeCast Manager and root node deployement, the new playlist encoder receiver can create the Ogg stream from a given playlist of wav, ogg or mp3 files. Thus, the FreeCast root node can broadcast a playlist without a third application. This feature requires the usage of native libraries and is available for the moment under Linux x86 and Windows platforms (Mac OS contributors are welcome). Based on tritonus libvorbis binding (http://tritonus.org/).

Feature.Title: FreeCast Manager Setup GUI
Feature.Item: A new "Configure FreeCast" menu appears in FreeCast Manager. This setup dialog allows for the moment the configuration of the root node receiver. You can switch from the default demo content to your own playlist (via the embedded ogg encoder), or receive the Ogg stream from a third party application.

Feature.Title: Improved Windows installer
Feature.Item: With the help of numerous windows users feedback, the Windows installer has been improved. Shortcuts have been added to make easier user configuration. FreeCast startup scripts have been improved to fix several issues.

Feature.Title: FreeCast Manager
Feature.Item: The FreeCast Manager is a graphical interface for tracker and root node. JavaWebStart, no configuration, predefined content, internal http server

Feature.Title: GUI improvements
Feature.Item: A systray icon is now available for Gnome and Windows platforms by using the JDesktop Integration Components (https://jdic.dev.java.net/).
A popmenu regroups all available actions.
Startup errors are now catched and displayed.

Feature.Title: Http loading for GUI customization resources
Feature.Item: Swing node can be customized via simple configuration options and http resources.

Feature.Title: Log dialog improvement
Feature.Item: The log display has been simplified. Icons are now used to illustrate the log level. To make easier the user issue report, an email can be sent directly with the log.

Feature.Title: Port range
Feature.Item: Port range can now be used into the configuration to avoid configuration problems for listen ports used by FreeCast. The possible ports are silently tested.

Feature.Title: Multiple reference
Feature.Item: A node can now specify a reference which can contain several inet references. This allows to the node to be accessible from several networks, like Internet and a local network.

Feature.Title: Automatic reference
Feature.Item: To avoid a manual configuration step, an automatic reference is determinate by the node. It includes a public reference (determinate via the freecast.org server) and local references.

Release.Summary: Threora support, stream signature, XML configuration

Feature.Title: XML Configuration
Feature.Item: Tracker and nodes use now a configuration system (based on the Commons Configuration API). The option -config allows to specify a configuration file at startup. The option -dryryn allows to test this configuration without starting really the application. All configuration details are described into the User Guide.

Feature.Title: Stream Signature
Feature.Item: The FreeCast stream can now be signed by the root node. The listener nodes can verify the signature.
Use freecast-keygenerator to generate the private/public keys. Use "-signer sign -signerURL <url>" to specify the private key to the root node and the public key to the listener nodes.
A simple checksum can be used instead of a signature, use the "-signer digest".

Feature.Title: Logical page management
Feature.Item: To improve the stream robustness, the FreeCast stream packets are regrouped into logical pages (corresponding to the contained Ogg pages). Incompletely received logical pages are ignored.

Feature.Title: Ogg Receiver refactory
Feature.Item: All Receivers which read a Ogg stream are now based on OggSourceReceiver. Receivers are renamed into PlaylistReceiver, ShoutClientReceiver, ShoutServerReceiver.

Feature.Title: Theora video codec support
Feature.Item: After minor improvements, a Ogg stream containing a theora logical stream can be transported by a FreeCast network. Many thanks to tim for the help.

Feature.Title: New source definition into the CLI node
Feature.Item: The option -source specifies now the source type. The -sourceurl provides the needed URL.
Available source types are: shoutclient (with the url of the stream to retrieve), shoutserver (with the listen address and port to receive the stream), playlist (with the playlist url) and none

Feature.Title: Adaptive header detection
Feature.Item: The Receivers detect now dynamicaly the Ogg pages to be included into the FreeCast stream headers.

Feature.Title: Ogg analysis improvements
Feature.Item: More informations are extracted from the Ogg stream (like the absolute granulate position). See the org.kolaka.freecast.ogg package

Feature.Title: ShoutClientReceiver
Feature.Item: Allows to receive stream from a shout serveur (like icecast). Use something "-source shoutclient -sourceurl http://localhost:8000/stream.ogg". Use commons-httpclient.

Release.Summary: Externel player support for the GUI

Feature.Title: External player support via http for the GUI node
Feature.Item: the GUI node can be accept http connections on the port 8001 (not configurable for the moment).
Use something like http://localhost:8001/stream.ogg.

Feature.Title: OptionalStartable
Feature.Item: allows to ignore an error during the start step of a Startable implementation

Feature.Title: PlayerControler and PlayerSource
Feature.Item: A node can support several players of different kinds (Audio and Http for the moment). The PlayerControler manages the Player instances created by one of the PlayerSource instance (dedicated to a Player kind).

Feature.Title: -noaudio option replaces by -player audio|http|null option
Feature.Item: the CLI node can be started with the -player option to control the PlayerSource instance used (only one for the moment).

Feature.Title: External player support via http
Feature.Item: the CLI node can be started with the "-player http" option and accepts http connections on the port 8001 (not configurable for the moment). Concurrent players are supported.
Tested with ogg123 and xmms. Note that some players doesn't support an URL without filename, so use something like http://localhost:8001/stream.ogg.

Feature.Title: Avoid freezed Swing GUI Node when the stop procedure hangs
Feature.Item: The JVM is shutdown after 10 seconds (from the stop beginning).

Feature.Title: Dynamic bandwidth and stereo support
Feature.Item: Ogg stream can now use any wanted bitrate (constant or not) and can be stereo

Feature.Title: TCP Socket tuning
Feature.Item: Sockets used between peers are configured with small read/write buffers

Feature.Title: FileReceiver improvements
Feature.Item: Added comment support the playlist reader. Improved the IOException processing

Feature.Title: Http tracker
Feature.Item: Tracker and nodes use now an http protocol (again RMI).
It has made possible with hessian and jetty. Thanks to fx and stephane for the idea.

Feature.Title: http download for the track directory
Feature.Item: The freecast sources were very heavy to download because of an import directory of 50Mb.

These resources are now download directly from the "sources". The track directory is defined via a virtual filesystem and synchronized by the prepare.track task. The whole synchronization takes 2 minutes.

Feature.Title: Build improvements
Feature.Item: Jar signatures is disable when no keystore is found. Modified the targets to avoid multiple jar signatures and documentation generations. Source export is now performed by the target export

Feature.Title: customizable Swing GUI
Feature.Item: Graphic resources are configurable via a properties file.
See http://kolaka.tryphon.org/freecast/docs/api/org/kolaka/freecast/node/swing/Resources.html

Feature.Title: FileReceiver
Feature.Item: Receiver implementation with allows to use a playlist of ogg files as source.
Use the -source option to specify the playlist file.

Feature.Title: XMLReleaseNotes
Feature.Item: Changelog started with XMLReleaseNotes (http://xmlreleasenotes.free.fr)
